document.h2: Learn how to use TYPETR typefaces in your designs
document.p: While designing the typefaces for the TYPETR library, we obviously have ideas, hints and tips how they can best be used in typography. And while producing them, many examples and type specimens are made for testing and presentation. Why not share these with people who take the effort to buy a full family license?
See the TYPETR websites featuring Upgrade (all type used in this website) and Bitcount as examples of what we could talk about.

ul.li: A day of exercises, feedback and initial introduction hangout: free of charge with a purchase of a full family license at Type Network
Access to examples, templates and DrawBot/PageBot script and programs.

document.h2: Learn how to use type and typography in corporate identities
document.p: You are doing projects for corporate clients that include the use of type in print and online. How do you select the right one? And if such a typeface cannot be found, how would you brief a type designer?
The right application of type and typography can also save money for your client. Sometimes even a lot. How about using that as an argument for your next identity project?
